parameters.name: service_component_name
parameters.description: Service Component Name. service_component_name must be a key in consul.

get.description: Binds the configuration for service_component_name and returns the bound configuration as a JSON

200.description: OK; the bound config is returned as an object

404.description: there is no configuration in Consul for this component

parameters.name: service_component_name
parameters.description: Service Component Name. service_component_name must be a key in consul.

get.description: Binds the configuration for service_component_name and returns the bound configuration, policies, and any other keys that are in Consul

200.description: OK; returns {config : ..., policies : ....., k : ...} for all other k in Consul

404.description: there is no configuration in Consul for this component

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: this endpoint tries to pull service_component_name:key; key is the key after the colon

get.description: this is an endpoint that fetches a generic service_component_name:key out of Consul. The idea is that we don't want to tie components to Consul directly in case we swap out the backend some day, so the CBS abstracts Consul from clients. The structuring and weird collision of this new API with the above is unfortunate but due to legacy concerns.

400.description: bad request. Currently this is only returned on :policies, which is a complex object, and should be gotten through service_component_all

get.description: This is the  health check endpoint. If this returns a 200, the server is alive and consul can be reached. If not a 200, either dead, or no connection to consul

503.description: the config binding service cannot reach Consul
